claims.claim: The combined JWST phase-curve and spectral analysis favors atmosphere-bearing models over a strictly no-atmosphere interpretation of TRAPPIST-1 b.

evidence.quote: A pure no-atmosphere model cannot simultaneously match both phase amplitude and spectral band behavior.
Joint fit likelihood ratio (atmosphere vs no atmosphere) | 7.4 | 1.0 baseline ratio | Atmosphere-bearing models better explain combined data products

claims.caveat: Model comparisons are conditioned on the specific retrieval framework and prior assumptions used by the authors.

claims.claim: The study reports a 15 um spectral feature compatible with atmospheric CO2 absorption in TRAPPIST-1 b.

evidence.quote: 15 um CO2 spectral band depth estimate | 96 ppm | Flat-spectrum null | Spectral structure is consistent with atmospheric absorption
Spectral structure near 15 um provides composition-sensitive evidence, especially for CO2-rich scenarios.

claims.caveat: The authors note residual degeneracies, so the feature alone does not uniquely fix composition without broader wavelength coverage.

claims.claim: Retrieved heat transport is non-zero, implying some day-night thermal energy redistribution beyond a bare-rock no-atmosphere limit.

evidence.quote: Heat transport efficiency (epsilon) | 0.19 (+0.23 / -0.14) | 0.0 for perfect no-atmosphere limit | Non-zero redistribution is favored
Thermal phase offsets and amplitudes probe day-night energy redistribution.

claims.caveat: The transport estimate is linked to circulation assumptions and can covary with cloud, opacity, and temperature-structure choices.

claims.claim: The inferred atmospheric pressure/composition remains uncertain, with both moderate-pressure CO2 and O2-rich alternatives not fully excluded.

evidence.quote: O2-rich atmosphere cases are not fully ruled out by current data.
Preferred pressure scale in CO2-rich retrieval family | 0.3-1.0 bar | Near-vacuum branch | Moderate-pressure atmosphere family remains plausible

claims.caveat: With only one planetary target, the data cannot yet eliminate all compositional branches or establish the true atmospheric state uniquely.
